website_summaries.verdict: A card game created by teachers with the goal of promoting mindfulness and social skills. Considered a "therapy" game.
pros: Though designed first for therapy purposes, they can also be used at home
These cards include fun activities, not just conversation starters
cons: The focus is on action more than discussion, so if you're looking for a conversation starter, this might not be the best pick

customer_reviews.title: These cards are okay
customer_reviews.text: The packaging and size of the cards are great. However, the cards are competitive—offering a winner and a loser; in fact, there are 10 cards that say “loser” and 15 cards that say “winner” and over 15 standard/basic cards to just read from... I like those cards better. I used a sharpie to blacken out the winner and loser section. There are no losers in mindfulness.
customer_reviews.author: Doasm Memoir: VBJ

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a game that two people could play, however you need multiple people for this. It also calls for a lot of tools. I don't have enough time within my sessions with my clients to play this even if it were only for two players. Just wasn't what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Chelly

customer_reviews.title: positive Social skills and Social interactions
customer_reviews.text: I have used the product for only one week, but the students appear to enjoy doing the tasks on the cards. It works well with students with autism like behaviors. I read the objectives before we begin and define mindfulness. Then a student picks a card and that person is the collaborator for the task. I really enjoy the discussion after the activity is done and discuss what they liked and what was difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Troup

customer_reviews.title: Win Win Win!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, my kids are so excited about the arrival of our new game. They have know idea how much they're gonna gain from this. This is a sure winner guaranteed to become a definite classic. Absolutely recommend this to anyone who wants a fun challenging approach to teach the kids something they will use on a daily basis!!! Winner!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally found what we were looking for! Best game we found online!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what me and my husband have been looking for. Being a 2nd grade teacher it was hard for me to find a quality game. The questions are fantastic and the quality is un matched! I have bought several others & I can say with confidence this is the game I will be using for our son and recommending to our students parents!
customer_reviews.author: Blessed Family

customer_reviews.title: A must have for kids!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for kids! With it being the summer, our kids would get bored easily, so we gave this game a shot and it has been a hit for us! We were looking for something that we could get our 16 year old and 10 year old to all be engaged in and this was just the thing. If you're looking for something that the entire family could get in on, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Good ideas & quality
customer_reviews.text: My almost 7 year old loves these. Always asks to play the cards. I play it with him and my 4 year old- they are young for most of the concepts but enjoy the little games and hopefully I can build on it as they get older!
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing
customer_reviews.text: They did such a great job of making this sound like it might be at least somewhat like a game; somewhat fun. Just because you put something on a playing card doesn't make it fun. It was just lame. I did this with my 9 & 11 year olds hoping that we would all gain a little something from it. It was all so... I don't even know the word. Boring is the best I can come up with. The answers were all so obvious. There were no challenges anywhere. No ah-ha moments. Nothing even cause one a moment of pause.
customer_reviews.author: aroe

customer_reviews.title: Useless for individual therapy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for work with teens in a private practice setting. Useless in 1:1 consultations. Needs a significant number of items available to use even with a group setting.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G. Ansel, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Buy more than one deck!
customer_reviews.text: SEL, Restorative, Trauma informed and necessary. Easy and fun. My only caution is that when it's reprinted, remove the attention to people's sizes. Esp in high school, they don't like to be singled out the way the game instructs the short kid to go first. It just draws more attention to their height and they're in high school. The rest of it is so awesome. You will want to order more decks after you see this. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description. To be used only with groups.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this intending to use it one-on-one with clients—however, after receiving it and reading the boxed directions, it’s to be used only with groups or multiple people. No where does it say this on the amazon description, so it’s very much not what I was expecting and I have no use for it. They should make this more clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great activities!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a school and purchased this to use with my students when when the new school year starts. The activities on the cards are great and cover a wide variety of scenarios. I can't wait to use them! I like that extension activities are also included. I think you could also use the cards as stand alone activities when time doesn't permit full game play or come up with your own way to use them. I foresee them being a useful and flexible resource in my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: busygirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for All Ages!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Special Education teacher who ordered this game to play with my Social Skills class. I played it with a group of middle school students (8th graders), and everyone- including my advanced students- loved it! The activities are age-appropriate and allow students to buy-in to the idea of mindfulness. I am excited to see how my high school students react to the game. The only constructive criticism I have would be to specify the rules a little more. We had a difficult time figuring out who gets the card after the activity is completed. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Had high hopes, disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The activities on each card aren't well thought out, some make no sense at all. Each round has a "loser" which seems counter productive for therapy sessions. Most activities involve doing something teenagers consider embarrassing, definitely not helping self confidence. A ton of typos throughout the deck. The true/false questions are useless, always coming down to "is mindfulness a good thing?" And the answer always being yes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Shipment received sooner than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: This item came in allot sooner than expected. My 11 year old and I went through some of the cards and had some great open-ended conversations. :) I look forward to us working on these. CBT, really helped me when I was younger and my son's teacher implements mindfullnes in her lessons. It really helps allot, as anyone of any age can benefit from being mindful and in the moment. My youngest son is 5 and I also ordered "sitting still like a frog activity book". Here's to being in the moment and focusing on the now.
customer_reviews.author: Sha

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this game. I used in an adult substance abuse group and it went over really well. A lot of them have issues with being in the moment and knowing how to cope appropriately. Teaching skills in a game format helped them be more accepting to learning skills as well as having fun while learning.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael L. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: fun game with lots of ways to play
customer_reviews.text: Used this game to teach children focus and how to find "happy thoughts" and the case is awesome for traveling and the cards have great ideas, however some options require other "props" which I did not realize ahead of time-just a heads up....You can play some ways without props. The children played along and were enjoying it-which was so amazing considering it was not screen time!
customer_reviews.author: CCD

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is not what I expected. I thought this would be more of a "game" but it's not. The kids were not interested and I found it difficult for them to stay interested. I doubt we'll play it again. The first card we pulled I found to be a bit disturbing - but I won't get into that. I gave it 3 stars because it seemed like a good concept for a game.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the questions didn’t make sense. My kids were incredibly bored when we tried it. I can’t imagine using it with any age group. The “chat pack” was much more engaging.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee Nolan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for KIDS TOO!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 8 & 10 year old boys. My older son has autism and this is a great way to teach him mindfulness and give us conversational prompts. We use them everyday to talk about philosophical questions and even to practice mind training. I think its good for all ages but consider this for children too! It would make an awesome gift, packed with so much wisdom and food for thought. ❤️👏
customer_reviews.author: Irma Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This isn't what I expected, it's very basic. All things you can make up on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Tania W

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good product...just not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I work as a counselor in a detox program for substance abuse. This seems like a good product just was not what I was looking for. I did not feel like this game would be applicable for the clients I work with, yet. As a result, I wound up returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: cee

customer_reviews.title: Dialogue starters
customer_reviews.text: By I am using this for 5th and 6th graders . The kids like it because they get to move around while learning . The cards have easy instructions to understand, I like the true or false ones because they give an explanation and dialogue starters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: I use it in group sessions and would recommend to anyone looking into practicing mindfulness.
customer_reviews.author: Allonci

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye coffee table books, hello coffee table cards!
customer_reviews.text: I got them for my office to use in my therapy practice with kids and families. They are quality cards and the packaging is really nice (if you’re a packaging nerd like me, you’ll appreciate it). Haven’t used them much yet, but so far they are more like activities, conversation starters, ideas...good for directing the focus toward self-reflection and compassionate listening.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pond

customer_reviews.title: TOO INVOLVED
customer_reviews.text: Many people may be more aware of what this product was all about. It wasn't what I was expecting, my granddaughters 11 and 13 weren't that interested in it. We were busy with other things, so I will give it a try after Christmas when we can spend more time getting the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Santini

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very well packaged and the cards seems very sturdy. I can’t wait to use these for my lesson plans with my students. The game can be easily modified for younger ages with reading assistance by older players.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Really helped my students open conversations
customer_reviews.text: The kids were able to use these cards to talk about what they were feeling about themselves and others were able to tell them how they saw them. It opened up the conversation about perceptions and mindful words and actions.
customer_reviews.author: S. H.

customer_reviews.title: New ideas that kids like
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually using the visualization and Mindfulness Practice cards in classrooms during a Mindfulness lesson. They are doing some of the activities in a small group of 4-5 and then I do one of the activities with the whole class. The kids really liked these ideas, and I think they'd love to play the game too if I had endless time with them. I might try and use the game in a small group, but for now the cards have been helpful to make them think about being mindful, noticing, and really paying attention in a fun way.
customer_reviews.author: Katie McCord

customer_reviews.title: Not what i was expecting
customer_reviews.text: As a clinician I was looking for a game that two people could play, however you need multiple people for this. It also calls for a lot of tools. I don't have enough time within my sessions with my clients to play this even if it were only for two players. Just wasn't what I expected
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for teaching mindfulness to 3rd-5th
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to use with my students yet, but it was bought for mindfulness lessons for 3rd-5th grade. Look forward to the different formats the cards can take. I do have to agree with others that I need to be prepared with the objects the cards ask for or just take those cards out of the stack. The cards give a wide variety of info on mindfulness and various activities related to the topic.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hardister

customer_reviews.title: Good intention poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, it sounded more fun than it was. We had more fun hunting for the items. The product is marketed for 8+ but I can attest my 9&8 yr old had mediocre fun at best rereading wordy instructions much less being a leader at judging the winner loser scenario. The intent of this game was to build on being in the moment but while in the moment the person is judging others. Hence the sum of my review - Good intention poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. R

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I hoped to use these cards with my children. I could have just made up anything off the top of my head. They lack creativity and insightfulness.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: They are well done and extremely useful
customer_reviews.text: I am using these cards to help someone with a brain injury. My purpose is to stimulate thought process and to help in proper behavior and reactions. This is an excellent tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a counselor
customer_reviews.text: Played this with 8-11 year olds & they loved it! Great solutions to anxiety, stress, anger, and test anxiety. It’s difficult to find games like this!
customer_reviews.author: becky garthwaite

customer_reviews.title: Be mindful
customer_reviews.text: My students have already started playing this game and they love it. Watching the conversations grow in front of me is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Calo26

customer_reviews.title: Mindfulness activities for children and youth.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these cards with elementary school aged children and they love the cards and the activities. It’s a great way to help them access their 5 senses with games, information and activity cards. They are for groups more than individuals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun with mindfulness.
customer_reviews.text: This wonderful cards are wonderful to use in a group setting, everyone enjoys these cards because of their bringing people more to mindfulness, recommend these cards for any group setting.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Classroom!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game for my classroom! It’s great for brain breaks and morning meetings! A great resource to pull out when you have time and incorporate social emotional learning into everyday time! Love it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Spiwak

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to help with managing emotions.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it yet, but I am sure my middle school students (I'm a school based mental health counselor), will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: C. T.  McKenney

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for anything to help my 6 year old son. He shares two homes and sometimes he struggles with anxiety. I found this on amazon and I can’t wait to work with my son. I think it looks fun and enjoyable. I think this product is great and I am so blessed and thankful that I found it! Totally worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea for that therapist in your life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a therapist friend. She loves it! Great ideas for all ages!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excited to try!
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this game but I haven't had a chance to use it as yet. The card list some exciting activities that I know my patients will enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how well this will work with a class of 35+ students.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Udelhofen

customer_reviews.title: Kids need to play this!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this game. I got it to play it with my 13 year old son and my 7 year old daughter and they both love it. But I think my little girl loves it more. I really enjoy the fact that it gives you exercise to be present in the moment, something I’ve been wanting to teach my kids for a while now. Thank you so much for making these types of games. Keep them coming!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Not a game in the usual sense
customer_reviews.text: Not really a game. Sort of a deck of cards full of cbt tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Chanteé

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Great! Using these everyday while guaranteed due to the virus
customer_reviews.author: Moman Blasino

customer_reviews.title: Some cards are helpful
customer_reviews.text: It was not as creative/ original as I thought it was...
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to use this product yet, however, from what I have reviewed it appears professionally made and a lot of efforts seem to have been made in its construction.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Mindfulness and Fun
customer_reviews.text: This Mindfulness game is great for working with both children and adults in a therapeutic setting.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlynn Silva

customer_reviews.title: Very good find!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in therapy with children and teens. It is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: nicole marie

customer_reviews.title: Great therapuetic tool
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time today with a young client. She responded well to it and I think that it will work well for teaching mindfulness skills to all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Castleman

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Great item and just what I need for my clinic
customer_reviews.author: Nik  R

customer_reviews.title: Cousolers friend
customer_reviews.text: Going to be a really fun game and great for groups and clients
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Mindfulness is a powerful tool to have!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a good 10 years becoming more centered and mindfulness was a major help to my whole experience! So when I found this game & ordered it! And it came so quickly!!
customer_reviews.author: bullheimer

customer_reviews.title: Learn while having fun! Awesome mindfulness game!
customer_reviews.text: I am a school based mental health practitioner at a K-12 school. I use this game with grades 3-12 and the kids always love it! This is the best work related purchase I have made!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Raiter

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved it and didn't even notice that they were learning something
customer_reviews.author: Funky Cold Medea

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this product in Mindfulness class in a recovery program and the clients like but they don't realize I get good information from them at the same time
customer_reviews.author: Marie Virden

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Therapy and in Homes.
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like the concept and the idea behind the game. As a Behavior Therapist/Lead Adaptive Skills Trainer, I will be using these with my older clients to help with anger management and to decrease anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: Marine Terteryan

customer_reviews.title: deceiving
customer_reviews.text: This item requires that I buy items to go with it. I think that should be in the advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: age alert
customer_reviews.text: the product claims appropriate for ages 8 and up. content is not appropriate for younger kids. i think its a good product for teens.
customer_reviews.author: gary kennett

customer_reviews.title: Good family game,
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who has been struggling with emotional regulation. My Mother happened to be visiting when it arrived and the two of them sat and played a few rounds while I cooked dinner. It was a really sweet visit and made me smile to listen to them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVEEE this product , I am an in home therapist and am always looking for new activities to do with kids/adolescents and this can be used for all ages and is very unique and we'll designed. Package is super convenient an stylish same with the cards!I'll be telling my colleagues!!😁😁😁
customer_reviews.author: Matt Keniston

customer_reviews.title: Nice filler...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice addition to other mindfulness activities and works well with individuals or groups.

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning game
customer_reviews.text: The game was interesting and some of the exercises were fun.
customer_reviews.author: Rate On

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these cards!! As an existential mindfulness counselor, they will get so much use!!

customer_reviews.title: Beginners Mindfullness
customer_reviews.text: Excellent way to engage and incorporate Mindfullness in teens and adults. Not childish, but really good way to shed light on beginners mindfullness and all its benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to practice mindfulness
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the game once so far, but it was a hit! I work at an inpatient psychiatric hospital and used this as a group activity for practicing mindfulness. The group members enjoyes playing and so did I!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Booth

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for DBT mindfulness skills
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I use this with my clients. It is a fun way to learn mindfulness!

customer_reviews.title: Just for fun learning
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase for my job, all the staff and clients are enjoying this game 🙂

customer_reviews.title: Excited to use my cards!
customer_reviews.text: I am excited about this purchase. I can't wait to use it for my social skills group!

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Works really good for games to play with patients during therapy or any kind of setting where you need to build coping skills, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kaden Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great for groups
customer_reviews.text: I use this in group therapy, and my kids love it! You can easily adjust or skip activities based on age level, so I’ve been able to use it with 1st and 2nd graders all the way up to high schoolers. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for my students!
customer_reviews.text: Recently this year I have introduced mindfulness into my practice as a social worker. Not only in the school I work in but with in home therapy. My students and clients enjoy this game and have truly benefited from the tools provided. They have used this as a game or have looked at cards individually and utilized them. Highly recommend!!!

customer_reviews.text: Not really a game. There are a few activities but it’s not ABA social skills approved for this BCBA.

customer_reviews.title: I like the take away from this game
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my 8 and 5 year old. 8 year old loves it, 5 year old not so much

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this game.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this, used a few cards my first day with it and my Client got a big kick out of em.

customer_reviews.title: Great for use in group sessions
customer_reviews.text: The game is good for use with kids and teens. I've used it mostly in groups Product arrived on time and in good condition for the seller.

customer_reviews.title: Great Game to use in Therapy
customer_reviews.text: I will use in game in therapy and practiced w/my therapy team. We agreed it was great for mindfulness and kept us grounded.

customer_reviews.text: Really cool game me and my son’s like it. It teaches you how be one the here and the now.

product_meta.title: Mindfulness Therapy Games: Social Skills Game That Teaches Mindfulness for Kids, Teens and Adults Effective for Self Care, Communication Skills 40 Cards for Play Therapy
feature_bullets: 💌 DESIGNED BY TEACHERS | Hello! We’re InnerIcons. Nice to meet you! We’re a socially conscious and eco-friendly company based in the USA that teaches mindfulness-education. We believe in value and quality, your purchase donates to charity! We stand behind this educational game. If you’re not happy with your purchase for any reason, simply email us at InnerIcons and we will be glad to help.

🎲 ENGAGING, FUN TO PLAY CARD GAME | Unlike other therapy tools, our mindful game engages the inquisitive minds of kids & adults during group counseling sessions. This game not simply a deck of affirmation cards, it is a variety of fun activities developed to help you feel grounded, find calm, improve focus and relax. The fun never stops when learning that mindfulness matters!
